Sway.data.ActiveRecord.name: Sway.data.ActiveRecord

params.name: storage
params.description: object used to access the underlying data structure

Sway.data.Model.name: Sway.data.Model

props.name: state
props.description: initial state

Sway.data.Field.name: Sway.data.Field
Sway.data.Field.description:
A Field represents a single value of an {{#crossLink "Sway.data.ActiveRecord"}}{{/crossLink}} model. It can represent a simple field definition, or an association; an relation between two models. var username = new Field('username', { friendlyName: 'User name' }) , password = new Field('password', { type: 'password', friendlyName: 'Password' }) , address = new Field('address', { key: 'address', type: 'belongs_to', model: Sway.data.Address, friendlyName: 'Address' }) ; Furthermore, a Field can also hold information about data transformation, which is used by the persistence layer var accountInfo = new Field( 'accountInfo', { type: 'BLOB', friendLyName: 'Account info', transformers: [encryptFilter, compressFilter] }) ;

Associations

This Active Record implementation is based on the Ruby on Rails (RoR) ActiveRecord Associations.
The following associations are available:

BELONGS_TO and HAS_ONE (THROUGH) Association

Assume an 'Account' belongs\_to a 'Supplier'. Or the other way around, a Supplier has\_one Account. Furthermore, if an 'Account' and 'Supplier' both has\_one 'AccountHistory', it could look like this var Account = new Sway.data.ActiveRecord( 'Account', storage, [ new Sway.data.Relation({ key: 'supplier', type: 'belongs_to', model: 'Supplier' } // creates a field 'supplier_id' new Sway.data.Relation({ type: 'has_one', model: 'AccountHistory' } // AccountHistory should have a account_id field ..... ]) ; var Supplier = new Sway.data.ActiveRecord( 'Supplier', storage, [ new Sway.data.Relation({ key: 'account', type: 'has_one', model: 'Account' }) new Sway.data.Relation({ key: 'accountHistory', type: 'has_one', through: 'AccountHistory', model: 'Account' }) .... ]) ; var AccountHistory = new Sway.data.ActiveRecord( 'AccountHistory', storage, [ new Sway.datat.Relation({ type: 'belongs_to', model: 'Account' }) // creates an 'account_id' field ... ]) ; ... supplierRecord.accountHistory = someAccountHistories An belongs_to field is always required!!

HAS_MANY (THROUGH)

This association define a one-to-many or a many-to-many relationship. new Sway.data.Relation({ key: 'orders', type: 'has_many', model: 'Order' }) ; // one-to-many new Sway.data.Relation({ key: 'patients', type: 'has_many', through: 'Appointment', model: 'Patient' }) ; // many-to-many

HAS_AND_BELONGS_TO_MANY

This relation is identical to HAS\_MANY THROUGH (many-to-many), except it doesn't have a third model new Sway.data.Relation({ key: 'assemblies', type: 'has_and_belongs_to_many', model: 'Assembly' }) And the association in the other moddel look like new Sway.data.Relation({ key: 'parts', type: 'has_and_belongs_to_many', model: 'Part' })

props.name: type
props.description: type of the field or association

props.name: model
props.description: referenced model

props.name: through
props.description: specifies a join model. Only available for <tt>HAS\_ONE</tt> and <tt>HAS\_MANY</tt> associations

props.name: friendlyName
props.description: description of the field

props.name: PK
props.description: primary key field (there can only be one primary key field)

props.name: autoIncrement
props.description: Primary key field is auto-incremented (auto generated key)

props.name: index
props.description: put an index on the field

props.name: unique
props.description: unique field

props.name: compoundIndex
props.description: names of the compound index it is part of.

props.name: required
props.description: a required field

props.name: transformers
props.description:
list of transformer objects. A transformer object can transform the data into a new form and also back
into its original form. Think of, zipping and unzipping or encrypting and decrypting

props.name: validators
props.description: list of validation functions

Sway.ux.Form.name: Sway.ux.Form
Sway.ux.Form.description:
Form generator. This class provides a Fluent API to construct forms.

     new Form(json)
         .fieldset()
         .label('username').text()
         .label('password').password()
         .submit(callback)
         .clear() ;

Sway.DI.name: Sway.DI

Sway.EventHub.name: Sway.EventHub
Sway.EventHub.description:
EventHub facilitates event-based communication between different parts of an application (Event driven system).
Events can be namespaced too.

Namespaces are separated by a dot, like

    bar.foo1
    bar.foo2
    bar.bar1.foo1

A Namespace and an Eventname are actually more or less the same thing:

    eventHub.on('bar', myFunc1) ;
    eventHub.on('bar.foo1', myFunc2) ;
    eventHub.on('bar.bar1', myFunc3) ;
    eventHub.on('bar.bar1.foo1', myFunc4) ;

The advantage of namespaced events is that it facilitates triggering groups of events

    eventHub.trigger('bar') ;        // --> triggers: myFunc1, myFunc2, myFunc3 and myFunc4
    eventHub.trigger('bar.bar1');    // --> triggers: myFunc3 and myFunc4

props.name: allowMultiple
props.description: accept multiple registrations of a function for the same event name

classitems.description:
Call this function to make it aware of changes made to the data it relates to. Because a Model instance
has no direct link with, for example, a database, this mechanism only works when all changes made to the data are performed
by one and the same storage object. This storage object is responsible for the notifications.

Always call {{#crossLink "Sway.data.Model/unlink:method"}}{{/crossLink}} to disable this behavior, or when the Model instance
otherwise, the
If the record or this <tt>link</tt> is not needed anymore, make sure to remove by calling {{#crossLink "Sway.data.Model/unlink:method"}}{{/crossLink}},

classitems.description:
Register a class by creating a contract. Use {{#crossLink "Sway.DI/getInstance:method"}}{{/crossLink}} to obtain
an instance from this contract. The <tt>params</tt> parameter is a list of contracts,  and, if needed, normal
constructor parameters can be mixed in.
classitems.name: register

params.name: classRef
params.description: the class bind to this contract

params.name: params
params.description:
list of constructor parameters. Only if a parameter is a string and matches a contract, it
will be replaced with the corresponding instance

props.name: singleton
props.description: create a new instance every time

props.name: description
props.description: describes the contract (currently only used by {{#crossLink "Sway.DI/listContracts:method"}}{{/crossLink}}).

classitems.description:
Returns an instance for the given contract. Use <tt>params</tt> attribute to overwrite the default
parameters for this contract. If <tt>params</tt> is defined, the singleton configuration option is ignored.
classitems.name: getInstance

classitems.description: List all available contracts with their description to <tt>console.log</tt>
classitems.name: listContracts

classitems.description:
Contains available event modes. For example, if <tt>bar.foo</tt> is triggered, both event modes do the opposite

                   | |                                     / \
    ---------------| |-----------------     ---------------| |-----------------
    | bar          | |                |     | bar          | |                |
    |   -----------| |-----------     |     |   -----------| |-----------     |
    |   |bar.foo   \ /          |     |     |   |bar.foo   | |          |     |
    |   -------------------------     |     |   -------------------------     |
    |        Event CAPTURING          |     |        Event BUBBLING           |
    -----------------------------------     -----------------------------------

The event model implemented in this class does both, going from <tt>bubbling</tt> to the execution of all callbacks in <tt>bar.foo</tt>, then back in <tt>capturing</tt> mode

                                  | |  / \
                 -----------------| |--| |-----------------
                 | bar            | |  | |                |
                 |   -------------| |--| |-----------     |
                 |   |bar.foo     \ /  | |          |     |
                 |   --------------------------------     |
                 |               event model              |
                 ------------------------------------------

    eventHub.on('bar.foo', myFunc1) ;
    eventHub.on('bar', myFunc2, Sway.EventHub.EVENT_MODE.CAPTURING) ;
    eventHub.on('bar', myFunc3, Sway.EventHub.EVENT_MODE.BUBBLING) ;
    eventHub.on('bar', myFunc4, Sway.EventHub.EVENT_MODE.BOTH) ;
    eventHub.trigger('bar.foo') ; // -> callback execution order: myFunc3, myFunc4, myFunc1, myFunc2 and myFunc4
classitems.name: EVENT_MODE

classitems.description: Defines the capturing event mode
classitems.name: EVENT_MODE.CAPTURING

classitems.description: Defines the bubbling event mode
classitems.name: EVENT_MODE.BUBBLING

classitems.description: Represent both capturing and bubbling event modes
classitems.name: EVENT_MODE.ALL

classitems.description: Generates an unique event name
classitems.name: generateUniqueEventName

classitems.description:
Triggers one or more events. One event is triggered if the 'eventName' parameter targets a specific event, but if this parameter is a namespace, all nested events and
namespaces will be triggered.
classitems.name: trigger

params.name: eventName
params.description: name of the event or namespace

params.name: data
params.description: data passed to the triggered callback function

props.name: traverse
props.description: trigger all callbacks in nested namespaces

example:
Sway.eventHub.trigger('ui.update', {authenticated: true} ) ;               // trigger the 'update' event inside the 'ui' namespace
        Sway.eventHub.trigger('ui', {authenticated: true} ) ;                      // trigger all nested events and namespaces inside the 'ui' namespace

classitems.description:
Register a callback for a specific event. Callbacks are executed in the order of
registration. Set 'prepend' to TRUE to add the callback in front of the others. With the 'options'
parameter it is also possible to execute the callback in a capturing or bubbling phase.
classitems.name: on

props.name: prepend
props.description: if TRUE, the callback is placed before all other registered callbacks.

props.name: eventMode
props.description:
the event mode for which the callback is triggered too. Available modes are
         <tt>capture</tt> and <tt>bubble</tt>

return.description: TRUE if the callback is registered successfully. It will fail if the callback was already registered

example:
Sway.eventHub.on( 'ui.update', this.update.bind(this) ) ;
        Sway.eventHub.on( 'ui.update', this.update.bind(this), {prepend: true, eventMode: Sway.EventHub.EVENT_MODE.CAPTURING} ) ;

classitems.description:
Register a callback for a specific event. This function is identical to {{#crossLink "Sway.EventHub/on:method"}}{{/crossLink}}
except that this callback is removed from the list after it has been triggered.
classitems.name: one

props.name: prepend
props.description: if TRUE, the callback is placed before all other registered callbacks.

props.name: eventMode
props.description:
the event mode for which the callback is triggered too. Available modes are
         <tt>capture</tt> and <tt>bubble</tt>

return.description: TRUE if the callback is registered successfully. It will fail if the callback was already registered

classitems.description:
Removes the given callback for a specific event. However, if a callback is registered with an 'eventMode', the
callback can only be removed if that eventMode is specified too!
classitems.name: off

params.name: callback
params.description:
the callback function to be removed. If omitted, all registered events and nested
namespaces inside 'eventName' are removed

params.name: options.eventMode
params.description: the event mode for which the callback is triggered too. Available modes are

return.description: the count of removed callback functions

classitems.description: count the registered callbacks for an event or namespace
classitems.name: countCallbacks

params.name: eventName
params.description: the event name for which all registered callbacks are counted (including nested event names).

params.name: eventMode
params.description: the event mode; Sway.EventHub.CAPTURING or Sway.EventHub.BUBBLE

return.description:
the number of callback functions inside 'eventName'. Returns -1 if the event or namespace does not exists
TODO: etype is not used

classitems.description: returns the the trigger count for this event
classitems.name: countTrigger

return.description: trigger count. -1 is returned if the event name does not exist
